head.title: GREENBURGH: ORDER TO HALT PROJECT UPHELD

hedline.hl1: GREENBURGH: ORDER TO HALT PROJECT UPHELD

abstract.p: New York State Supreme Court Appellate Division, agreeing with lower court order, halts construction on four houses in Greenburgh built by developers William and Edward Baker without obtaining subdivision approval (S)

block.p: Neighbors recently won another round against two Greenburgh developers who may have to tear down four houses because they failed to seek subdivision approval from the town's Planning Commission. The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn agreed with a lower court's order to halt construction on the houses until the developers, William and Edward Baker, obtain subdivision approval. Greenburgh's building inspector has issued a permit for the project, but Justice Peter M. Leavitt said that the Planning Board should decide because the project involved combined lots. The developers have until tomorrow to submit their subdivision proposal.
